post.body: Here, have a photo of a nice pigeon
Ok. Why is ZeroME limited to one hub? Why can I not choose to switch freely between hubs or even follow a few one in the same time?
So ACTA2 is accepted. I hope thanks to it ZeroNET and FreeNet will gain more users and their development will accelerate.
So, what are you all doing on this sunday afternoon?

comment.body: People will not start using zeronet/freenet unless normal internet will be unusable.

@Realjohndoe: something like native freenet-client only apk would be great. Just with small database for caching and acting only like peer and not normal routing node (so you save battery/memory life/internet bandwith).
@lavaphox: some small hobby diy project or house roof PV installation?

@lavaphox: I got similar project but on much smaller scale - to power small x86 server from solar. Currently I am gathering 18650 cells from laptop batteries to build DIY powerbank. Not high priority project, I don't even have a spot welder yet.

@lavaphox: i have free access to broken laptop batteries. "Broken" often means just broken control electronic inside battery or dead 2-3 out of 6/9 depending on configuration. Some cells I gathered have over 90% of rated capacity so are almost unused. That is great for small DIY projects.
